intro: Senecio chitaganus, commonly known as the Chitagan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. Senecio chitaganus is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique biome with high biodiversity.
